SCI 6483
Information
Tactile Painting

Assistive Toolbox for Visual Impairment

Laser Etch
3d-Print
Assignment_1
April 2023
Title
Category
Assignment
Date


The objective of this project is to explore the possibility of creating a tactile experience for individuals with visual impairments by translating artwork into laser etching. Specifically, the project aims to develop a tool that can convert paintings into three-dimensional models that can be printed using a 3D printer. In addition, the project will investigate the feasibility of translating color into a pattern for laser etching to create a more comprehensive tactile experience. The project's significance lies in its potential to provide individuals with visual impairments access to artwork in a way that they can experience and appreciate. The project also has broader implications for the field of art and design, as it seeks to push the boundaries of traditional 2D artwork by creating an interactive and tactile experience. To achieve the project's objectives, the research will involve investigating existing tools and techniques used in laser etching and exploring different methods for converting paintings into three-dimensional models. The project will also require testing the feasibility of converting color into a pattern for laser etching and evaluating the effectiveness of the resulting tactile experience. Ultimately, the project aims to provide individuals with visual impairments access to a more comprehensive and interactive experience of artwork through laser etching technology.

Quoc Dang
Karen Kuo
Yunsong Liu
